result.execSummary:
The defendant Keith A Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence. STRAIGHT TIME.
If the defendant successfully completes all the terms of this sentence, the agent may deem the sentence completed after 6 months.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges. Any remaining balance at the end of probation will be due immediately or an entry of a civil judgment.
Provide a DNA sample and pay all associated surcharges.
Obtain and maintain (full-time) employment, school, or combination of both.

Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety.  
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

timeConds.notes: Successfully complete 20 hours of community service with a non-profit organization.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.   Defendant sentenced to serve 3 months (STRAIGHT TIME) in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 2 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 1 year.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
     *   Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
          and successfully complete recommended treatment.
     *   Maintain absolute sobriety.  
     *   Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
          treatment deemed appropriate.
     *   Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges. 
          Any remaining balance at the end of probation will be due immediately or 
          an entry of a civil judgment.
     *   Obtain and maintain (full-time) employment, school, or
          combination of both.
     *   Successfully complete 20 hours of community
          service with a non-profit organization.
     *  Provide a DNA sample and pay all associated surcharges.
If the defendant successfully completes all the terms of this sentence, the agent may deem the sentence completed after 6 months.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit, received and filed

Defendant Keith A Williams in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Defendant Keith A Williams in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Received discovery and offer.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Keith A Williams in court.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br.24  for a Pretrial Conference.vb
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 7/15/15 @ 1:30pm
